result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A. Stanley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Restitution to be determined within 60 days.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence.

09:59 AM Defendant Robert A. Stanley in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, by telephone.  Robert A. Stanley appeared by video means from Oshkosh Correctional Facility.  Def. heard on petition for Sentence Adjustment.  DA can't hear a word the defendant is saying and requesting adjournmentt.  Court ask def. to talk slower. Def. reads letter. DA heard every third word. Court suspends hearing at this time.  Court has no verification of time serve, attach completion of programs, & prison conduct report. Court will allow def more time to file documents and request new date. Court suspends hearing. No new set defendant needs to request hearing.
(Judge not signing order at this time)

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert A. Stanley in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Robert A. Stanley in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls  @ 10:07 am.  State gives plea agreement,  plea to ct1 DRI Ct'1 & 6 years prison, 3 years initial confinement  3 years extended supervision. Restitution to be determined, Defense is free argue.  Atty Bennett & def. agrees to plea agreement.  Plea questionnaire & waiver of rights.  Def. understands charge & penalties. Ct 1 Burglary, no contest plea.  Ct's 2-6 DRI. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights. Def. understands elements. Atty Bennett is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given, Stipulate to factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea & finds def. Guilty to Burglary, 943.10(1m)(a). State gives sentencing argument. State gives def. prior convictions. Atty Bennett gives sentencing argument & recommendation impose & stay prison sentence, probation, jail, huber. Def. makes statement.  Judge touches on sentencing. State reads victim impact statement. Credit ? Court orders, costs only, Restitution to be determined within 60 days. Restitution hearing may be requested. $250 Surcharge, DNA Sample, Def. advised of firearm & voting rights. Credit 89 days,  imposed & stay  10 years prison,  5 years initial confinement &  5 years extended supervision stay 6 years probation, 12 months jail, consecutive to any other sentence, 89 days credit if revoked, AODA treatment, Huber privileges, Def. is eligible for Challenge Program, Def. is eligible for Substance Abuse.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advise of postconviction rights.

Defendant Robert A. Stanley in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Robert A. Stanley in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called 15CM71, 15CM27, 14CM159 and 15CF220.   15CM220 def will waive right to preliminary and balance of cases are sentencing after revocation.   15CM220 Court reviews right to preliminary with def.  Def waives right to preliminary.  Court accepts waiver.  Information filed.  Waive reading.  Reserve jurisdictional objections.  Not guilty pleas entered.   Court will receive not guilty pleas. Status conf  02-08-16/3:30 pm  Issue of bond.  Arguments presented by Atty Bennett.  Response by State for cash bond to remain.  Rebuttal by Atty Bennett.  Court sets bond at $1000.00 cash
15CM27, 71 and 14CM159.  State has received revocation packet.  Defense has copy.  No corrections.  State presents sentencing arguments.  15CM27 State request 9 months jail.  14CM159  9 months jail  15CM71 Ct 1 90 days jail and Ct 2 9 month jail.  Credit of 80 days and civil jmt for court obligations.  15CM71 Victim in this case K.A. gives statement.  Atty Bennett presents arguments.  Statement by def.  Court  15CM71 Ct 1 - 90 days jail, credit 80 days.  Ct 2 - 7 month jail concurrent with ct 1. and credit.  15CM27 7 months jail, concurrent with 15CM27 Credit 80 days.  14CM159 7 months jail credit 80 days.  Concurrent with previous sentences.  Huber privileges.  Court obligations converted to civil jmts.    Requesting some jail time be serve as inpatient treatment.  Court will order up to 90 days  of 7 months jail sentence can be served as inpatient treatment.  Post conviction rights
